Azrael thanked the gods in his head that the attack had hit and worked. He watched as the dust seeped out of the Knightâ€™s arm before turning his attention back to their opponent.    

~~Oh, youâ€™re approaching me?~~ â€œSir Knight, I ask you once again to step aside and allow us to pass,â€ he replied to the Knight.    

Upon seeing the knight not attack but move, Azrael decided to attack once again. He swung his flamberge sword downwards once again, aiming for the Knightâ€™s left shoulder, in the hopes of cutting off his left arm. If it worked then hopefully that would guarantee that the Knight couldnâ€™t use his weapon... unless he could hold it with one of his feet which Azrael wouldnâ€™t really be surprised by after all the things heâ€™s seen so far.   

*â€Monty Python and the Holy Grail... please donâ€™t fail me now,â€* he said in his head.

Azrael backed up more upon hearing Paidi scream. He cringes as the familiar feeling of a panic attack washed over him. He felt warm and weak, nauseous, dizzy, and shaky. He would have a tremor every few moments. The worst part was the overwhelming sense of fear, self-hatred, and guilt that swarmed over him.   

He focused on trying to calm the kid instead of the panic attack and the voices in his head. He made sure to keep a safe distance between the two of them. He knew what it felt like to be in moments like this. He knew not to reach out for the other.    

â€œItâ€™s okay. Iâ€™m not a threat. I wonâ€™t hurt you,â€ Azrael spoke in a soft tone, his voice a bit weak and shaky from the anxiety attack and voices.

Azrael was sitting on the hill near the entrance reading a book. He was a short for his age and had dark brown hair that went down to his shoulders in curls.     

He loved to just sit out in the nature and read. However, he didnâ€™t look like he went outside much. His skin was extremely pale.   

He was snapped out of his book when he heard sobbing and saw a child under the pine tree. He closed his book and approached the child.   

Azrael kneeled down to her height and looked at her out of concern. His normally cold look that filled his grey eyes was instead one of worry and warmth.  

â€œWhatâ€™s wrong?â€ he asked her in a quiet and gentle voice.

Azrael unsheathed his sword. He knew of no other way but to fight. They had to fight. At least he thought they did. Perhaps the knight would stand stil and let him cut off his arm..? He hoped so.   

â€œMy apologies, knight, but we must get through,â€ he apologized.   

With those words, he swung his sword downwards, aiming at the knightâ€™s right shoulder, to try and cut the knightâ€™s arm off like in the movie. The arm made the most sense to aim for because it was sort of used to control a weapon and thatâ€™s what was next in the movie scene. Plus, maybe the knight was right handed?   

u/SalemtheBat

Azraelâ€™s eyes widened when he saw the creatures go onto the ship. He had no idea what they were. Were they in books? He really shouldâ€™ve spent more time reading about ancient monsters instead of romance novels and fantasy books.    

He was snapped out of his thoughts when one of them hurt Mercury. Now that pissed him off. He couldnâ€™t care less if they were to attack him, but Mercury was a different story. No one hurts Mercury.   

He tried to kick the monster away from Mercury. He had no idea if theyâ€™d be able to defeat them. Their biggest priority at the moment was to not get killed and get into the Underworld. They needed to keep them back.   

He tried to get loose from his bindings. He grasped at the hilt of his sword and pulled it out as much as he could. He held the sword against the rope with his chin. With that, he used his hands to move the rope up and down against the blade of his sword. Eventually the rope broke and he was free, although his chin was a bit red from the hilt pressing against it. He inwardly thanked those â€˜life hacks that could save your lifeâ€™ videos that he used to watch. He then cut Celâ€™s bindings.      

â€œWeâ€™re going to need to hold them off long enough until we get into the Underworld. I have no idea if weâ€™ll be able to kill them so just try not to get yourselves killed,â€ Azrael informed his teammates, a sense of panic in his voice.   

With those words, he unsheathed his sword and wielded it. He started to have an adrenaline rush as his body realized the life or death situation he was in. He pulled Mercury behind him as a way to keep him protected since he was injured.

â€œCel, would you be able to help me hold them back? Your bow will probably be good for that. And, Mercury, would you be able to help from afar with magic? If not then donâ€™t push yourself. Youâ€™re injured,â€ he tried his best to give out a battle strategy, â€œAnd ghostly crew, I want you guys to go back to and focus on keeping the ship together. Continue to sail us down the Acheron into the Underworld. We need to get into the Underworld as soon as possible. My teammates and I will hold off these creatures and keep them from hurting you guys. Weâ€™ll er... keep you guys safe. So get to it!â€   

There wasnâ€™t really a way for the ghosts to actually get hurt. At least not that he was aware of. However, he felt that maybe if he told the ghost that then theyâ€™d calm down a bit.   

u/SalemtheBat
Oh I remember those! Theyâ€™re in my siblingâ€™s room. I love those books!

Azrael stopped trying to break loose from the ropes when he felt Mercuryâ€™s hand in his. It didnâ€™t calm him or stop the horrible things he was being told and seeing, but it did help bring him back to earth, well, Underworld.   

He was on a ship, in the middle of the Acheron, on a quest with a team whilst having an anxiety attack. At least the anxiety attack helped to distract him somewhat. He never thought there would be a day where he would be grateful for an anxiety attack.   

Celâ€™s magic brought in a slightly calming aura. It wasnâ€™t too much, but it definitely was appreciated and helped. However, he frowned upon noticing Celâ€™s weariness. Maybe Cel would be able to take a small nap? Heâ€™d offer up his shoulder for Cel to use. They probably had time because of the boat ri- and he thought too soon.   

The cackling got most of his attention, minus the part split between focusing on his anxiety and the part trying to combat the voices. He looked up upon being addressed.   

â€œSilence, please,â€ he spoke to the crew in Ancient Greek before turning his attention fully to the experienced sailor, â€œExcept you. Please, untie us first. Also, if it is possible, may three spirits of the ghostly crew be sent out to scout the area and see who or what made the noise? Also, do you know what is happening? Thank you.â€   

They were most likely going to have to fight. Normally Azrael was fine with laughing. Creepy cackling from out of nowhere, however? That was a hell-to-the-fucking-no. He hoped heâ€™d be in a decent fighting condition if battle was needed. He was a bit shaky from fear and from the screams, but heâ€™d have to ignore it.   

He looked to Cel, â€œWeâ€™re most likely going to be attacked. Would you have the strength to fight? If not then Mercury and I will fight them and try to keep them from getting near you. Okay?â€   

He then addressed Mercury, â€œYou cool with that, Dolphin?â€   

u/SalemtheBat

Azrael kept his voice at a whisper.   

â€œBut what can we do? Iâ€™m not quite sure brute force would work. Look at him. If we attack with no strategy, weâ€™ll most likely lose. If we try to sneak past, heâ€™ll hear our footsteps. If the only way is to attack then our best shot would be to try and hit him in the same spots as in the script or try to find a weakness in his armor or come up with a fighting strategy. Unless you know of a plan that might work... then thatâ€™s the best bet we really have,â€ Azrael frowned, â€œIf weâ€™re going to fight then Iâ€™ll attack first if youâ€™d prefer.â€   

u/SalemtheBat

Azrael returned Mercuryâ€™s smile with a weak one. He knew things wouldnâ€™t be fine. Things never went fine. Theyâ€™d be lucky if they came out of this alive.   

He cringed at the fastness of the trireme and the fact that it could break judging by how beaten down it looked. He never was a fan of boats, especially when they went fast and didnâ€™t look very stable. If he had known they were going to go sailing, he wouldâ€™ve packed ginger drops.   

Azrael rested his head on the wood as he clenched his eyes shut and continued to cry. He was starting to have an anxiety attack on top of everything. His breathing had noticeable quickened. He felt unbearably warm. He felt nauseous and dizzy and weak. He had tremors every now and again. He was shaking.   

He couldnâ€™t tell if his fear of boats made things worse with the voices or better. Half of his thoughts were â€˜Weâ€™re going to die. This ship is going to crash. Iâ€™m going to end up vomiting. I shouldâ€™ve just stayed at camp and continued to play Animal Crossing. Fuck my life.â€™. The other half, however, was still trying to fight the voices and keep himself semi-sane.   

The voices continued to try and convince him to jump in the water or stab himself with his sword. They told him he wouldnâ€™t be a nuisance anymore if he just went into the Acheron. Everyone would be happier without him. Heâ€™d also be at peace if he went in is what they told him. Heâ€™d be free. He wouldnâ€™t be in constant misery anymore. Heâ€™d be happy and calm.   

If it wasnâ€™t for him being tied, he wouldâ€™ve ended it right there whether it be by sword or by the Acheron. However, despite his efforts of trying to break lose, he couldnâ€™t.   

He needed to calm down. He was thinking irrationally. He needed to help his teammates calm down. The singing didnâ€™t help. His teammates probably couldnâ€™t even hear it. He needed a distraction...   

â€œHey,â€ he weakly started, his voice as shaky as his body, â€œLetâ€™s try and name different colors. Iâ€™ll start. Crimson, sea foam green, fuchsia...â€   

It was a trick his mum had taught him. She said itâ€™s what she does with anxiety to distract her mind. She also taught him to try and say the ABCs backwards, but he had done it so many times that he had it memorized now. Colors were fun, and there were a lot so it would probably last them awhile.

During those times my mind just usually stays silent as the voices tell me to bite harder. After awhile of trying and failing because the nerves unconsciously stop me from biting all the way, my mind would tell me to stop and that itâ€™s not working. The voices would then stop telling me to bite my fingers and continue to scream other things at me.   
Also, itâ€™s totally fine! I can see why someone would be curious. I find stuff like this very intriguing too.
No. My teeth arenâ€™t strong and sharp enough. However, I do leave pretty deep teeth indents that would last hours and then leave marks that would take days to finally go away.

Sort of. The voices never completely stopped. For awhile after I would try and fail, due to the still sane part of my mind stopping me, the voices would stop for awhile like a day. There are still times where I randomly try to bite of my right thumb which is the same one I would always try to bite off back then.

For me they were more in my head. They werenâ€™t like me actually thinking them. They were voices, but I was aware that they were all in my head. However, for people with schizophrenia for example, it would seem real like someone was actually talking to them. Thatâ€™s where the similarities between my illness and schizophrenia end. Before that, theyâ€™re very similar. The big difference is psychosis. Iâ€™m not psychotic so Iâ€™m aware that the voices are just in my head. However, the temptation to do what the voices tell you is still very strong since they tell you it over and over again. I remember there would be times where I would try to bite off my fingers because I heard that they can be bitten off like carrots except the nerves stop you. I never succeeded before though, so I canâ€™t really prove if the carrot statement is true or not.

I donâ€™t really have any idea as to why Iâ€™ve had voices telling me to cut my fingers off before. It would just randomly happen when I was around the same age the person in the picture was. I always had voices telling me to hurt myself, but to me it was quite weird when they told me to cut my fingers off.
I find it disturbing how specifically this is, yet I relate to this so much.
Dunno. I like his philosophy vids and the Minecraft ones though.
Please donâ€™t do it. I understand that itâ€™s hard, but you have to stay strong. Life sucks ass, but you need to keep fighting. You canâ€™t give up yet, mate! Keep marching on!
You look amazing!

Azrael had not seen the letters that started forming on his forearm as he pushed down the sleeve of his jacket.   

He glanced over at the other two for a moment. He felt like Cel didnâ€™t like him which caused the river to say **â€œNo one likes you.â€**. He told himself that there were people who liked him. Mercury, Luna, his mum... However, the voices just continued to spin lies about them.  

While Cel was able to quickly put on a happy act, Azrael wasnâ€™t. He looked weary and had a look of pure anguish as the voices continued.   

**â€You donâ€™t deserve any form of love. You always abandon your loved ones. You left your mum to die. You left her and your sister with a broken family that you broke. You left Carter when he was crying and begging for you to stay. You abandoned all of them. You threw them away. You only care about yourself and your own needs. You donâ€™t even care about your mother. You left her behind. You left her to die. You left her with your stepfather. You abandoned her. Your family would be happy if you would join us. Theyâ€™d be happy without you. Your stepfather would be happy if you were gone. He hates you, and so do your mother and sister. You broke the relationship between your mother and stepfather. All their fights are about you. Theyâ€™re happy now that you arenâ€™t there. Theyâ€™d be even happier if you joined us in the river.**    

That made Azrael cry. Tears pooled up in his eyes before they started to bead and fall from his eyes. He didnâ€™t bother wiping them away. He just let the tears fall and walked onto the trireme and gave a small wave bye to the Oracle.   

He looked at the rope and cut it in three, so they can each be tied down to the ship. He then went over and tied Cel to the mast as he cried. Normally he would crack a joke about it like any normal teenager would. However, at the moment, the only thing Azrael could focus on was fighting against the voices.    

With that he silently handed two ropes to Mercury, one for him to be tied down with and one for Mercury to be tied down with. He sat down and waited for Mercury to tie him down. He would then try his best to assist Mercury with the task of, well, tying Mercury.   

The word â€˜trierarchâ€™ helped jog Azraelâ€™s memory about the time when he was forced to learn about the ship for a history.  

He spoke in Ancient Greek, as thatâ€™s what the spirits had spoken in, which was quite torturous when he had voices screaming at him and since it wasnâ€™t technically a first language.   

â€œAlright. Please sail this trireme into the Underworld,â€ Azrael ordered.

Azrael had involuntarily flinched when Cel ripped his hands away and yelled. He never did do well with yelling. He listened to Cel and shut up. He also kept his distance but close enough to grab him if he tried anything. He knew that would probably be the best way to deal with Cel at the moment.   

He listened to the Oracle of the Dead and nodded, a frown on his face, â€œI see...â€   

It was a shame that the Oracle couldnâ€™t come along. He mustâ€™ve been lonely. He wondered if the other spirits talked to him.   

â€œGot it,â€ he responded to the Oracle of the Dead.  

He was relieved that it was only his own blood he had to spill at the moment. He could handle that. Also pain helped ease the mind. At least it did for him. It would provide him a bit of a distraction and some relief from the river.   

However, judging by the way the spirit said â€˜goâ€™, he assumed the spirit meant that his teammates better get up and sacrificing or else things would go down. With that, he unsheathed his sword and looked at the other two.   

â€œWe each need to make a blood sacrifice to the shrine of the King of the Underworld. Our own blood, that is. I suggest we get to it if you guys want to make it past the Acheron,â€ Azrael explained, leaving no room for argument, â€œWe have to get moving. Plus, Hades deserves the sacrifices.â€   

u/SalemtheBat

â€œGuess it runs in the family,â€ Azrael simply stated.   

His mum was like that too. She despised things that involved group work. He couldnâ€™t blame her. Most of the times teams screwed you over. You rarely got good teammates. Why like groups when you can just do it by yourself?   

â€œJust checking. Some injuries never fully heal or heal improperly, especially with broken bones. The human body is very complex after all,â€ he shrugged before he raised an eyebrow, â€œWhat did he do..?â€
I need that mask

Azrael nodded as he took a sip of his water. Heâ€™d have to keep those words in mind when having to work with a team. When someone was behind, sometimes he would move on without them. That... most likely wouldnâ€™t turn out well. Itâ€™d be a good idea to keep Derekâ€™s words in mind especially when on a quest.    

â€œI see. Iâ€™ll have to remember that as Iâ€™m not the best with working in teams,â€ he replied, â€œOn the other hand, are you feeling better?â€

Azrael inwardly thanked the gods that he and Mercury were actually smart for once and ordered celestial bronze armor. If it wasnâ€™t for that then they would be double screwed. They still were very screwed if the plan didnâ€™t work but less screwed then they couldâ€™ve been.    

He hoped the plan would work. If not then they would most likely be dead, well, temporarily dead. However, he must have hope and not be pessimistic! The plan was obviously a dumb and strange plan, but it was the only thing he could think of that might actually work. Heâ€™d re-go over in his mind how it could work out, but after the first sentence his mind already got bored with it and started to think of more interesting things.   

He soon fully shook himself out of his thoughts when Mercury spoke once again. He really hoped this plan would work. He didnâ€™t want Mercury to get hurt. Heâ€™d feel terrible if Mercury got hurt.    

u/SalemtheBat

It was the only strategy Azrael couldâ€™ve thought of. If they were to try and normally force their way through then they would have most likely taken a sword to the stomach. While if the knight was programmed for, well, this then... he got defeated in the scene so there was a chance that they may be able to win if following the dialogue.    

As soon as that part was over, Azrael immediately stopped galloping. He wasnâ€™t that big of a fan of acting unlike Mercury. He silently watched as the scene unfolded.    

u/SalemtheBat

â€œWhat... about the rest of your team?â€ Azrael hesitantly asked, â€œDid they try and help you at all?â€   

A small hint of a smile appeared on Azraelâ€™s face for a quick moment at Derekâ€™s next words.   

He gave a nod, â€œThank you.â€

Azrael turned and looked at Mercury whom was now by his side. He shook his head and offered him a small, reassuring smile.  

â€œMercury, Iâ€™ll be fine. Cel on the other hand needs help. He needs the support more than I do. He needs our help,â€ Azrael frowned, â€œI appreciate it, but... Celâ€™s the one who needs it right now.â€   

He turned his attention back to the Oracle of the Dead. What exactly was happening again? Oh. He wanted to speak to his grandparents and cousin, and he also wanted to prove himself worthy to Hades. But why did he want to prove himself to Hades? What did Hades ever do for him? He never even paid child support. Why should he care what Hades thinks about him?    

That was the river messing with his head. He needed to just try and ignore it more. The river seemed welcoming to him though.   

What did he have to prove? That he was a coward? That he always runs away? That he practically left his mum to die at home? The river was very hard to resist. Why did he try to resist? What was the point in him living? The river would be his freedom....    

â€œPardon me, sir, but Iâ€™m going to have to talk to you from afar,â€ he apologized to the spirit, hoping the spirit would get angry.

He looked over at Mercury, hoping he would follow, before he went over to Cel and kneeled down to his level. He pulled Cel into a tight hug and closed his eyes.   

â€œCel, the river is lying. Itâ€™s trying to trick you. All the things itâ€™s saying to you are lies,â€ he informed Cel, â€œIt wants you to react this way, but you have to try not to give in.â€   

His heart ached at the Oracleâ€™s words. He was alone. His brothers had already left. He wondered if the Oracle of the Dead might be able to come with them on the journey. Would they be able to reunite him with his brothers?    

â€œA sacrifice? As in... something or someone that is dead?â€ He hesitantly asked the Oracle, â€œAlso, do you know if it would be possible for you to come with us? If you wanted would you be able to cross the river with us?â€   

After that, he turned his attention back to Cel. He pulled away but held onto Celâ€™s hands and looked at him. He had no idea what Cel was seeing or hearing, but he could tell it was effecting him a lot.   

â€œIâ€™m sorry for not coming over sooner, Cel. Please donâ€™t listen to The Acheron. Itâ€™s trying to use your fears and pain against you. I know that itâ€™s hard, but youâ€™re strong. I know I just met you, but I can tell youâ€™re really strong,â€ he tried to reassure Cel.

Azrael watched as Evan had stayed silent and just gave a nod. He didnâ€™t expect Evan to say anything in response, so it didnâ€™t bother him too much. He hoped that maybe one day Evan would believe those words if he didnâ€™t already.   

That was a first for Azrael to hear someone say that to him. He appreciated it. It would seem that those words Evan had said would mean a lot to him because they did.   

â€œYouâ€™ve been really nice to me too. Iâ€™m glad you see me as your friend. I think of you as my friend, so... Iâ€™m glad you do too,â€ Azrael quietly replied.   

Heâ€™d never say it aloud, but he had always felt lonely growing up. Books couldnâ€™t block out everything. No matter how desperately he tried to hide and get lost into his books, theyâ€™d never fully block out the world or his emotions.   

Azrael continued to search the sky for The Huntress. He searched the sky for the cluster of stars that looked like a girl getting ready to shoot her bow.

Azrael looked back at Cel and frowned. He wanted to go over and help him, but he figured that wouldnâ€™t go down well with the spirit. He needed to stay and continue talking to the spirit. Heâ€™d have to help later.   

**â€Youâ€™re selfish. You always put yourself before others. No wonder no one likes you. Youâ€™re greedy. Youâ€™re selfish. Youâ€™re envious. Think of how many lives would be better if you just jumped into the river.â€**   

Azrael ignored the voices as best as he could. He needed to focus on the task at hand. Azrael shook his head at the Oracle of Deathâ€™s words even though he wouldnâ€™t be able to see it. That wasnâ€™t the reason he came down. That was just what they had to do. If he had only done it to mimic Heracles, a hero he didnâ€™t even like, then he wouldâ€™ve joined all the Olympics.   

â€œNo, itâ€™s not. My main reasons for coming to the Underworld is to learn more about it and to try and talk to Lord Hades. Iâ€™ve also come down to try and find some answers about my cousin and to see my grandparents if possible. I want to know if a few certain people made it to Elysium or not. I also want to talk to a few spirits. I certainly didnâ€™t come down just to mimic Heracles. That... would probably be one of the last things Iâ€™d ever want to do. Iâ€™ve come for answers and to speak to some of my family members,â€ Azrael explained as best he could.

There was another thing, but he wanted to check with Mercury first. He wanted to see if Mercury would want to know.    

The river still continued to distract him, showing him different images. One was an image of his mother crying on the couch, another of his mum and stepfather arguing.    

**â€Look at all the pain youâ€™ve caused your mother. Because of you she suffered from two strokes. Because of you she had to quit her job. Because of you she always fights with your stepfather. You caused her so much stress. She hates you. She regrets having you. You ruined her life. Your family would be happier if you were dead. Youâ€™re just a nuisance. They hate you. No one loves you. You donâ€™t deserve love. Join us in the river.â€**   

He kept glancing at the river every few seconds. He wanted to jump. He wanted to so badly. Heâ€™d be better off dead.
